title: get_plus_minus_changes — get_plus_minus_changes
text: Get predictions compositional ilr multiple linear regression model

title: get_plus_minus_changes — get_plus_minus_changes
code: get_plus_minus_changes(   dataf,   y,   comps,   comps_fup = NULL,   covars = NULL,   deltas = c(0, 10, 20)/(24 * 60),   comparisons = c("one-v-one", "one-v-all", "prop-realloc")[1],   longAnalysis = c("prospective", "change")[1],   alpha = 0.05,   verbose = FALSE )

title: get_plus_minus_changes — get_plus_minus_changes
text: dataf Data frame data y String name outcome dataf comps String name composition variables dataf comps_fup String name follow-composition variables dataf (optional) covars String name covariates deltas vector time-component changes (proportions compositions, .e., values -1 1) comparisons Two choices ("one-v-one" "prop-realloc") longAnalysis  alpha Optional, level significance results (default = 0.05) verbose Whether print output progress console.

title: get_plus_minus_changes — get_plus_minus_changes
text: Data frame predictions

text: Get predictions CoDA models

title: get_predictions_coda — get_predictions_coda
code: get_predictions_coda(   data = c(),   comp_bl = c(),   comp_fu = c(),   comp_names = c(),   outcome_bl = c(),   outcome_fu = c(),   covs = c(),   comparisons = "prop-realloc",   increase = c(),   decrease = c(),   delta = 30,   model = "change" )

title: get_predictions_coda — get_predictions_coda
text: data Data frame composition (baseline /follow ), outcome covariates comp_bl names composition variables dataset (baseline) comp_fu names composition variables dataset (follow , optional) comp_names names composition variables visualization outcome_bl Name outcome baseline dataset outcome_fu Name outcome follow dataset (optional) covs names covariates dataset comparisons Tow options: "one-v-one" "prop-realloc" increase name behavior increase (name visualization) decrease name behavior decrease ("one-v-one") delta minutes reallocate prediction (e.g., +30 min) model "cross-sectional", "longitudinal", "change"

title: get_predictions_coda — get_predictions_coda
text: Matrix predictions

title: Basic function for cross-sectional linear regression CoDA models — lm_coda
code: lm_coda(   data,   compo,   outcome,   covariates = c(),   moderator = NULL,   scale = FALSE )

title: Basic function for cross-sectional linear regression CoDA models — lm_coda
text: data data frame matrix variables interest compo String colnames composition variables matrix/dataframe variables outcome String colname outcome numeric vector outcome covariates String names covariates (optional) matrix/dataframe variables moderator Optional string colname interaction term (default = NULL) scale Logical. Whether standardize results (default = FALSE)

title: Basic function for cross-sectional linear regression CoDA models — lm_coda
text: Linear regression model (lm class)

title: lm_coda_long — lm_coda_long
text: Run compositional linear regression models using isometric log ratios. Option perform longitudinal models moderation analyses implemented.

title: lm_coda_long — lm_coda_long
code: lm_coda_long(   compo_baseline,   compo_followup = NULL,   outcome_baseline,   outcome_followup = NULL,   moderator = NULL,   longAnalysis = c("prospective", "change")[1],   covariates = NULL,   scale = FALSE,   balance = NA,   data )

title: lm_coda_long — lm_coda_long
text: compo_baseline Variable names baseline composition compo_followup Variable names follow-composition (optional) outcome_baseline Variable name baseline outcome outcome_followup Variable name follow-outcome (optional) moderator Moderator variable, (optional) longAnalysis Longitudinal analysis perform, either prospective changes now. covariates Numeric, matrix, data frame covariates adjust models scale Logical, whether standardize output (default = FALSE) balance Balance behaviors used ILR coordinates data Data frame data

title: reallocationPlot — reallocationPlot
text: Visualization predictions CoDA model

title: reallocationPlot — reallocationPlot
code: reallocationPlot(   dc_obj = c(),   data = c(),   comps = c(),   comps_fup = NULL,   comps.names = c(),   outcome = c(),   covs = c(),   comparisons = c("one-v-one", "prop-realloc")[2],   increase = c(),   decrease = c(),   xlab = c(),   ylab = c(),   xlim = c(),   ylim = c(),   ReallocationLimits = c(-60, 60),   xaxis.by = 5,   ribbon = TRUE,   font = "Times New Roman",   main = NULL,   col = "black",   alpha = 0.2,   analysis_type = c("cross-sectional", "longitudinal")[1],   total = NULL )

title: reallocationPlot — reallocationPlot
text: dc_obj Object derived lm_coda lm_coda_long comps String name composition variables dataf comps_fup String name follow-composition variables dataf (optional) comps.names Names composition variables appear plot (use comps provided) outcome String name outcome dataf covs String name covariates comparisons Two choices ("one-v-one" "prop-realloc") increase variable composition increase visualization (replacement) decrease variable/s composition decrease visualization (replaced) xlab X axis label ylab Y axis label xlim Limits X axis (time reallocation limits) ylim Limits Y axis (autogenerated provided) ReallocationLimits limits reallocation time minutes (vector 2 numbers) xaxis.X axis ticks every xaxis.minutes ribbon Logical. Whether plot confidence intervals predictions font Font use (default = "Times New Roman") main Title plot col Color lines confidence intervals alpha Alpha transparency confidence intervals analysis_type One "cross-sectiona", "longitudinal", "change". total Total time constrain composition .

title: zComposite — zComposite
text: Calculates z composite scores set variables, possibility stratify sex implemented

title: zComposite — zComposite
code: zComposite(   x = c(),   x_fu = c(),   id = c(),   sex_strata = FALSE,   sex = "Sex",   age = c("Age_I", "Age_II"),   refs = NULL,   df )

title: zComposite — zComposite
text: x Names variables included composite score x_fu Names variables included composite score follow (calculate z score change) id Participant identifier variable sex_strata Logical. Whether stratify composite score sex sex Name sex variable data frame. age Name age variable dataset. used reference values provided refs refs Reference values , example, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.atherosclerosis.2018.10.003 (important reference values data frame presents colnames variable names df) df Data frame variables calculate composite score

title: zComposite — zComposite
text: Data frame composite z score calculated
